content.title: Financial Assistance To Disabled Children (HBOCWWB)
content.department: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana
content.beneficiary: Children of registered construction workers with disabilities
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance to Disabled Children (HBOCWWB)' was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana. Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹2000/- per month is given to the children of registered workers who are declared by the medical authority 50% or more physically or mentally disabled. Further, it is necessary for the registered worker to have regular membership of one year for availing of the benefits of the scheme.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹2000/- per month is provided to the children of registered workers who are declared by the medical authority 50% or more physically or mentally disabled.
eligibility: The construction worker should be registered under Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB).
The registered worker must have a minimum of one-year regular membership.
The registered worker who has dependent children with 50% or more physical/mental disability is eligible to apply under the scheme.
The worker should have a disability certificate of 50% or more physical or mental disability of his/her dependent children issued by the District Medical Board.
The dependent child's name has to be included in the ration card.
The dependent child of the registered worker has not availed of the benefit of the scheme in the current financial year from any other Haryana Government Department/Board/Corporation.
The dependent child of the worker should not have any source of income.
The dependent child of the worker should not be married.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter Card
Disability certificate issued by Govt. Medical Board
An affidavit that the dependent child has not availed the benefit of the scheme in the current financial year from any other Haryana Government Department/Board/Corporation.
An undertaking that the dependent child has no source of income and the child is not married.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance of ₹2000/- per month to the children of registered workers who are declared by the medical authority 50% or more physically or mentally disabled.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The registered worker who has dependent children with 50% or more physical/mental disability is eligible to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Can a general category worker be eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for all categories of workers.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Haryana State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident/domicile of Haryana State.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for workers to have a regular membership of the board?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is necessary for the registered worker to have regular membership of one year.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance of ₹2000/- per month is given to the children of registered workers who are declared by the medical authority to be 50 percent or more physically or mentally disabled.

faqs.question: What should be the percentage of disability to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The dependent child of the worker should have 50% or more physical or mental disability to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is a beneficiary taking the benefit of the scheme from any other Haryana Government Department/ Board / Corporation eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the dependent child of the registered worker has not availed of the benefit of the scheme in the current financial year from any other Haryana Government Department/Board/Corporation.

faqs.question: Is a married dependent child of the worker eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the dependent child of the worker should not be married.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker get registered under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: For registration, the construction worker should visit the Official Website of the Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: Is there any registration fee needed while registering under HBOCWWB?
faqs.answer: Yes, the first-time registration charges are ₹25/- and the registration fees vary according to the renewal time period.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible construction worker may apply online mode.

faqs.question: How can a construction worker apply online under the scheme?
faqs.answer: For online application, the construction worker should visit the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
